Corn_Gray_leaf_spot_00025.jpg.text:
The image shows a collection of plant leaf samples, each with different characteristics.

1. Gray Leaf Spot: The leaf has a gray base color with numerous small, round, and evenly distributed spots. The spots are uniform in size and color, and there are no visible damages or holes. The edges of the leaf are smooth and straight.

2. Northern Corn Leaf Blight: The leaf has a green base color with numerous small, irregularly shaped spots that are yellowish-brown in color. The spots are unevenly distributed and vary in size. There are no visible damages or holes. The edges of the leaf are smooth and straight.

3. Southern Corn Leaf Blight: The leaf has a green base color with numerous small, irregularly shaped spots that are yellowish-brown in color. The spots are unevenly distributed and vary in size. There are no visible damages or holes. The edges of the leaf are smooth and straight.

4. Anthracnose Leaf Blight: The leaf has a green base color with numerous small, irregularly shaped spots that are yellowish-brown in color. The spots are unevenly distributed and vary in size. There are no visible damages or holes. The edges of the leaf are smooth and straight.

5. Southern Rust: The leaf has a green base color with numerous small, irregularly shaped spots that are yellowish-brown in color. The spots are unevenly distributed and vary in size. There are no visible damages or holes. The edges of the leaf are smooth and straight.

The leaf edges are smooth and straight in all cases. The petiole of the leaf is not visible in the image.
